text.text_translated:
"Born in the USA" is a rock album.
The music is fast. It makes your feet move.
These are strong, old songs.
But the words have strong feelings.

The music has catchy rock melodies.
The songs tell stories about the bad side of the "American dream."
The "American dream" means this: Everyone in America can get rich and be happy. They must work hard.

Many songs are about the struggles of normal people.
These people work hard.
They feel angry and unhappy.
Life does not give them money or good things.

For example, "Glory Days" is about people in a small town.
They remember their young days.
They felt the world was at their feet.
"Downbound Train" is about a young man.
His life is ruined when he loses his job.

It is easy to think the artist writes about real people he knew.
He writes about the life he might have had.
You will know about his very special way of making music.
People call him 'the Boss'.

best_attempt.text_translated:
"Born in the USA" is a rock album. The music is fast. Your feet move to the music. These are very strong songs. But the words have strong feelings. They carry emotional weight.

The music has catchy rock melodies. But the songs tell stories about the bad side of the "American dream." The American dream means everyone in America can get rich and be happy if they work hard.

Many songs are about normal people. These people work hard. They feel sad and very angry. Life does not give them money or great success.

For example, "Glory Days" is about people in a small town. They remember their young days. They felt the world was at their feet. "Downbound Train" is about a young man. His life becomes very bad. He loses his job.

It is easy to think the artist writes about real people he knew. Maybe he writes about his own life too. What if he was not a star? You will know about his very special skill. People call him 'the Boss'.
